text:
Generate a PM report in Markdown with these sections. Use the context below; cite repo_summary and instruction_block when making claims.

## Feature Inventory
- State framework (repo_summary.primary_framework) and repository type. If api_routes has items, list key endpoint areas; if empty, write one sentence: "No API routes in repo_summary.api_routes; specific endpoints cannot be enumerated."
- Mention entrypoint_files and any agent/structure components (e.g. structure_agent.py) with one-line purpose.
- List domain models grouped by area (Auth, Projects, Analysis, etc.) from repo_summary.model_hints; give one-line purpose per model or group where clear.

## User Flows
- Describe flows inferred from schema names (e.g. Signup: UserSignup → UserResponse; Login: UserLogin → Token). If api_routes is empty, add one line: "Concrete routes not in context; flows inferred from schema names only."
- Cover: auth, admin (if Admin* models), project lifecycle, analysis/execution, repository/search.

## Business Logic
- Summarize agentic or orchestration logic (cite instruction_block and entrypoint files). For analysis workflow, use model names (AnalysisConfigRequest, AnalysisControlRequest, AnalysisAskRequest, etc.) to describe config → control → ask → response.
- Note role separation (admin vs user) if Admin* models exist.

## Integrations
- Cite repo_summary.config_files, docker-compose, .env.example, requirements.txt, pyproject.toml when present. One line per integration type (containerization, env, dependencies, framework).
- If framework hints include multiple frameworks, state which is primary and that others are hints only unless confirmed.

## Limitations & Constraints
- List specific gaps: e.g. "api_routes empty (api_chunk_hits=N)", "only M entrypoint_files: [list]", "model hints are not guarantees of implementation".
- Do not repeat long caveats; keep to 4–6 bullet points.

Context (JSON):
{context_json}
